subtasks: Determining the pest to control
Selecting the appropriate pesticide
Choosing the correct formulation (liquid or dry)
Understanding the pesticide's active and non-active ingredients
Becoming aware of the pesticide's toxicity
Administering first aid in case of poisoning

tasks.task: Personal protective equipment (PPE) for pesticide application
subtasks: Wearing full-body cover (long sleeves, pants, and coveralls)
Using neoprene gloves that cover wrists
Keeping shirt sleeves outside gloves
Wearing goggles or a face shield
Changing clothes immediately after use
Cleaning and checking PPE daily
mixing and pouring pesticides below eye level
Working with wind to minimize drift
Operating application equipment to direct drift away from self
Keeping unauthorized people and children away
Monitoring signs and symptoms of pesticide poisoning
Avoiding pesticide drift into non-target areas
Using low pressure spray to reduce drift
Proper storage and transportation of pesticides
Casing and disposing of spilled pesticides
Disposing of empty containers safely

tasks.task: Safe handling and use of pesticides
subtasks: Reading and following all label instructions
Using appropriate equipment for application
Ensuring compatibility with formulations and application methods
Properly storing and disposing of pesticides
Taking precautions against inhalation and skin contact
